name: Paris, Provence and French Riviera Discovery Tour
description:
Go on a tour of Paris, Provence and the French Riviera!
Start your holiday in France with a few days in the capital city. Visit the most famous sights as well as hidden places on interesting excursions and food tours. Make sure to visit the Palace of Versailles and to have lunch on the Eiffel Tower, too. Continue your trip with a visit to the historic city of Avignon and get to know the Provence Region. At the end of your tour, you will spend some days in Nice and enjoy beautiful beaches and glamorous cities on the French Riviera. This tour will show you the highlights of France!

dayProgram.title: Paris - Paris
dayProgram.description:
Private transfer to your accommodation


A private driver will pick you up at the airport and drive you safely to your accommodation.




Private tour of Paris by night on a traditional Citröen 2CV

﻿

In just an hour, this night tour of Paris will reveal the magic of the French capital at night! Paris, City of Light, is never more stunning than at night, when she truly lives up to her name, with her illuminated avenues and spot-lit monuments taking on a fairy-tale dimension.


However, this is not a conventional tour: your night tour of Paris will be undertaken in a red-white and blue, open-topped Citroën 2CV, with an English speaking Parisian at the wheel!


During your nocturnal Paris trip you’ll be able to see all the highlights of central Paris: Avenue des Champs Elysées, Arc de Triomphe, Trocadéro , Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Pont Alexandre 3, Petit et Grand Palais, Place de la Concorde, Opéra Garnier, Place Vendôme , Louvre Pyramide, Ile de la Cité, Notre Dame Cathedral and Hôtel de Ville.


The tour includes:

Hotel pick-up and drop-off

Traditional Citroën 2CV


Duration: 1 hour


﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a boutique hotel in Saint-Germain de Prés
dayProgram.included_list: transfer arrival, guide, excursion, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Paris - Paris
dayProgram.description:
Small group tour of Paris with lunch on the Eiffel Tower


This morning make your way independently to 41 Avenue de la Bourdonnais , the departure point of your tour.


Discover the most famous Parisian landmarks in the heart of this iconic city with your expert guide!


Travel in style and comfort aboard your luxury minibus, which ensures a more intimate experience.


Enjoy a photo stop in front of the majestic Hôtel des Invalides, then be taken down the Champs Elysees from the Arc de Triumph to Place de la Concorde. Marvel at the Opera Garnier and keep your eyes peeled for Quasimodo while passing by the historic Notre Dame cathedral. Stop at Place Vendôme for more photos of this glamorous square and its famous column.


Then it’s time for a fabulous 3 course lunch at the ’58 Tour Eiffel’ restaurant, located on the 1st floor of the Eiffel Tower. The large bay windows boast spectacular views over the river Seine, Champs de Mars and Trocadero. You will take the elevator, with skip the line access to ensure a stress free visit.


Your tour ends at the Tour Eiffel (hotel drop-off is not included).


Duration: approximately 4 hours

﻿

﻿


﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a boutique hotel in Saint-Germain de Prés
dayProgram.included_list: entrance fees, transportation, excursion, lunch, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Paris - Paris
dayProgram.description:
Private half day guided tour of Versailles


You will be transported back to the Golden Age of France with a trip to the Château de Versailles, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and emblem of French royalty and extravagance. You will be guaranteed fast-track entry, allowing you to jump the queue and travel in comfort on a fully air-conditioned vehicle.


You will marvel at the breathtaking royal château, transformed by the ‘Sun King’ Louis XIV in the 1660s from a hunting lodge. Playground of the French monarchs, Versailles was the center of royal and political power until the French Revolution in 1789, which saw Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette forced to return to the capital.


Your professional guide will enable you to discover the State apartments of the King and Queen, the Royal Chapel and Hall of Mirrors, the epitome of French opulence: three hundred and fifty-seven mirrors line the gold-adorned hall and crystal chandeliers hang from the ceiling.


You will also have the time to explore the manicured gardens “à la française”, which mirror the splendor of the interior. Designed by the French landscaper André Le Nôtre in 1661 for the King Louis XIV, the 2,000-acre park is an architectural expanse of perspectives, parterres, fountains and groves that since its inception has defined what a French garden should be.


Your tour includes:

Hotel pick-up and drop-off

Skip the line entry

Professional guide


Duration: 4 hours

﻿


Suggestion: dinner and show at the Moulin Rouge cabaret

﻿

Experience an unforgettable evening at the world-renowned Parisian cabaret, the Moulin Rouge.


Relax and enjoy yourself with a quality meal created by the chef David Le Quellec. This dinner will be followed by the legendary "Feerie" show itself starting at 9.00 pm.


The "Fairy" cabaret review at the Moulin Rouge brings together an extensive troop of performers: 100 artists including 60 beautiful Doris Girls dancers recruited worldwide; 1000 costumes with feathers, glitter and strass made in the Paris' famous studios; and astonishing stage sets with rich colours and unique drawings created by Italian artists.


The show includes the best international entertainments as well as exceptional acts, and the eagerly-awaited return of the giant Aquarium. The world of rhinestones, feathers, and sequins is a revelation! Be amazed by the exceptional routines and numbers set against an original musical score played and recorded by 80 musicians. 

 

Please note:

- Guests should dress elegantly. No shorts, jeans or tennis shoes

- Mandatory paying cloakroom at the Moulin Rouge cabaret

- Children are accepted from 6 years old

- The show starts at 9.00 pm and ends at 11.00 pm 


The tour does not include:

Hotel pick-up / drop-off


Duration: 4 hours




﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a boutique hotel in Saint-Germain de Prés
dayProgram.included_list: guide, transportation, excursion, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Paris
dayProgram.description:
Gourmet Foodie Tour "History of French Luxury Gourmet Brands" - Paris


Paris has always been a great source of inspiration for French luxury brands. Nowadays these names have developed a reputation reflecting the excellence of French craftsmanship.


Hundreds of years of savoir-faire contribute to the prestige of French food and luxury brands across the world.


During your 2-hour guided walking tour through the fine shops in the elegant neighborhood of Madeleine, you will discover the history of famous French brands such as Fauchon, Hédiard, Ladurée and Maille.


Carole, your tour guide, will be very attentive to all your questions and let you in on the history of these long-established food brands.



Duration: 2 hours – commentaries in English – in groups up to 20 people.




Cheese and Wine Tasting in a long-established Parisian Cellar


Situated in the Marais quarter, in the heart of Paris, a long-established cheese maturing cellar from the 17th century will open its doors for a unique cheese tasting experience paired with excellent wines. Our specialized artisan will teach you the art of tasting.


The tasting includes: 7 cheese varieties paired with 2 glasses of wine plus fresh baguette.


Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes. Commentaries in English – in groups up to 15 people.




﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a boutique hotel in Saint-Germain de Prés

dayProgram.title: Paris - Avignon
dayProgram.description:
Private transfer from your accommodation


A private driver will pick you up at your accommodation and drive you safely to the railway station.



﻿Train ride from Paris to Avignon in 1st class


Duration: 3 hours.

﻿

﻿

Private transfer to your accommodation


A private driver will pick you up at the railway station and drive you safely to your accommodation.






Morning private walking tour of Avignon and the Pope's Palace


Join your local guide in a walk to discover the rich historical center of Avignon - a UNESCO World Heritage Site. 


Climb up to the top of the fortified medieval city walls and discover Avignon stretching in all its beauty along the Rhône river.


Enjoy skip-the-line access and follow your guide inside the Pope's Palace (entrance ticket included), the largest Gothic-style palace in Europe where successive popes resided between 1309 and 1377. In this maze of galleries, chambers and chapels, imagine its luxurious furnishing and sumptuous decoration from the medieval period.


Walk on the cobbled streets to the Place de l'Horloge; see the town hall, topped with its clock tower, and the theater.


Your tour will end up with a glass of Côtes du Rhône wine served in a intimate and historical place, mostly known by the locals.


Participants will be required to walk on cobblestone streets and climb many flights of steps during the tour. Therefore, comfortable walking shoes are recommended.

 

Duration: 3 hours.




﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a historic hotel in the heart of Avignon
dayProgram.included_list: transfer departure, train ticket, transfer arrival, guide, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Avignon
dayProgram.description:
All of Provence in one day guided private tour with minibus


Start the day by visiting the Pont du Gard, a stunning aqueduct bridge built by the Romans during the 1st century AD. It has been listed as a World Unesco Monument Sites since 1985.


After, you will head to Les Baux de Provence, a medieval village built on a rocky landscape. It is ranked among the most beautiful Provence villages located in the picturesque countryside of the Alpilles hillrange.


In St Remy de Provence, you will stop to discover the Roman monuments (a triumphal arch and a funeral monument), known as well to be the location where Van Gogh painted some of his most beautiful paintings.


Next on your visit of Provence is the area of The Luberon, where you will see Gordes and Roussillon, classified as two of the most beautiful villages in France. 


Gordes is known to be perched on a rock. Your free time will give you the opportunity to walk in its narrow cobbled streets and to see the dry stones, typical from the Luberon called « lauzes ». 


Roussillon is famous for its natural red and yellow ochre cliffs and for the red colour of the houses in the village.


From mid June to mid July, stop for a photo at Senanque Abbey to discover the lavender fields in bloom. When in Provence, a goal of your trip should be to learn as much as you can about lavender. A visit to the Lavender museum will teach you about the different uses for lavender and will allow you to see the old machinery dedicated to producing the essential oil. (entrance fee included)



Pick-up and drop-off from Avignon.


Duration: 9 hours

﻿


﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a historic hotel in the heart of Avignon
dayProgram.included_list: transportation, chauffeur / guide, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Avignon
dayProgram.description:
Private full day guided lavender tour - immerse yourself in the Provençal "Art de Vivre"


Discover the scenery of lavender fields in bloom in Provence.


Visit a traditional open-air market everyday in a different village of Provence and appreciate its stalls presenting a shimmering palette of fruits and vegetables and handcrafts, etc.


Drive along picturesque roads through wild lavender fields to Sault, lavender capital (photo stops) or Roussillon (depending on the flowering stage). Free time in Sault or Roussillon to wander and do some shopping in lavender shops.


Sault is a small town spread out along a low rocky promontory above the lavender fields - the plateau and village are at an altitude of more than 750 metres above sea level, with one side of the village winding around the top of a cliff. It is an exceptionally attractive village, both because of the historical centre and the beauty of the surrounding landscapes.


Roussillon is the capital of ochre. This small village, classified as one of the most beautiful villages in France, blends into the surrounding cliffs. As you walk through the narrow streets and enjoy the small squares, you see and feel the color that is an inherent part of its history.


Visit Gordes, hilltop village in Luberon, one of «the most beautiful villages in France», completely made with dry stones. The perched location provided protection from invasions during the Middle Ages. Dominating Gordes is the 16th-century Château de Gordes, a fortified castle with medieval corner towers and a grand doorway.


Visit the Lavender Museum in Coustellet, where you can learn about all the steps in the processing of lavender, from harvest to the production of lavender oil.


During the blooming season, a photo stop in sunflower fields will also be included in the itinerary.


Pick-up and drop-off from Avignon. Lunch at own expense.


Duration: 9 hours




﻿Overnight stay including breakfast at a historic hotel in the heart of Avignon

dayProgram.title: Avignon - Nice
dayProgram.description:
Private transfer from your accommodation


A private driver will pick you up at your accommodation and drive you safely to the railway station.


﻿Train ride from Avignon to Nice in 1st class

﻿

﻿Duration: 3 hours and 30 minutes.

﻿

﻿


Private excursion: Become "Niçois" in one day


"Nissa la Bella" - "Nice the beautiful" as the locals say! No other city in France offers such a variety of architecture types and styles than the capital of the French Riviera, also known to host the first baroque heritage of France.

 

Successively Celtic, Greek, Roman, Provencal, Savoyard, Piedmontese and French, Nice has a fantastic and unique history and you can still see traces of all these periods scattered all over the city.

 

From the Old town to the Cimiez hill, passing by the most striking districts, you will be taken on a journey through history, architecture, gastronomy, traditions, wine, panoramas, art and anecdotes. You will see the classics, but also the secret places off the beaten path, the real Nice, the Nice that locals love. 

 

Taste the typical “socca” in the market, try a “Nissart” restaurant in the old town (own expense) and discover a rare vineyard: the Bellet.

 

Your itinerary: Promenade des Anglais, Old town (guided walking tour), Cimiez, Cemenelum, Gairaut and the cascade, Russian cathedral, Mont Boron, Port Lympia, Castle hill, Musicians district, Promenade du Paillon, Garibaldi square, Low corniche, Nice downtown, Bellet hill with the Château de Bellet winery (Tuesday to Saturday only, subject to availability) or Falicon.


Duration: 8 hours

﻿

﻿

Overnight stay including breakfast at a historic hotel on the "Promenade des Anglais"
dayProgram.included_list: transfer departure, train ticket, guide, transportation, excursion, bedroom and breakfast

dayProgram.title: Monaco - Nice
dayProgram.description:
Private Excursion by minivan: Monaco Tour


There is more to the Principality of Monaco than what meets the eye. Beyond the exclusive resorts, there is a fascinating story! Let our guide tell you the history of the only nation in the world founded by a single family, the Grimaldi, and spend a day in the last example of a European city state.

 

To appreciate the "authentic” Monaco, you must understand how an isolated perched village became, through the centuries, a prosperous country which attracts the largest fortunes of the world. For that, we’ll take you to Menton, the gorgeous "pearl of France" and to Roquebrune, a medieval village with the oldest castle in France.

 

You will then discover the second smallest country in the world with a different perspective. Visit Monte-Carlo and its famous casino, the historic town perched on "the Rock", the antique port Hercules, the Larvotto seaside and its Japanese’s garden, the reclaimed land of Fontvieille, and of course the legendary circuit of the F1 Grand Prix. 

 

On request, see the exotic garden, or the ancient car collection of the Prince, or the prehistoric museum, or visit the palace. Entrance fees not included. With us, you will follow the scenic roads and enjoy the best panoramas. Pick-up and drop off at your hotel.

 

Itinerary: Upper corniche, Menton, Roquebrune village, Cap Martin, Rock of Monaco, F1 Grand Prix, Japanese garden, Monte-Carlo, Fontvieille.

 

In option:

  • Visit of the Grand casino of Monte-Carlo: 10€/pp + passport     
  • Visit of the Monaco exotic garden: 7.20€/pp

 

Duration: 8 hours.

 


Overnight stay including breakfast at a historic hotel on the "Promenade des Anglais"
